value.name: 100 Years After Tulsa Race Massacre, Black Mistrust Remains
value.description: There's been undeniable progress in the relationship between the Tulsa police and the city's Black community in the past 100 years. Then again, it's hard to imagine it could have gotten worse. Complaints about police bias and a lack of enough minority officers remain.
